H0.text: what language is spoken in haiti today. Haitian Creole

H1.text: what language is spoken in haiti today. Spanish

H2.text: what language is spoken in haiti today. English

H3.text: what language is spoken in haiti today. French Language

A4.text: Haitian Creole is spoken by virtually the entire population of Haiti.

A5.text: French is the primary written and administrative language and is spoken by 42% of Haitians.

A6.text: Spanish is spoken by some Haitians who live along the Haitian-Dominican border.

A7.text: English is spoken by Haitians due to American influence.

A8.text: The Constitution of 1987 names both Haitian Creole and French as the official languages, but recognizes Haitian Creole as the only language that all Haitians hold in common.

A9.text: French is spoken by only a small percentage of citizens.
